summary: This document is an email chain between U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) personnel discussing a FOIA lawsuit filed by The New York Times against the Bureau of Prisons (BOP) for records related to Jeffrey Epstein. The emails discuss legal strategy, coordination with BOP counsel, and the handling of related Touhy requests from civil plaintiffs.

persons.name: Robbie Kaplan
persons.context: Attorney for plaintiffs in civil litigation related to Epstein; mentioned as the point of contact for a Touhy request.

events.title: FOIA Answer Deadline
events.description: Deadline for the government to answer the New York Times' FOIA complaint regarding Jeffrey Epstein-related records from the BOP.

events.title: Coordination on Touhy Requests
events.description: Internal discussion to establish a point person for handling Touhy requests from civil plaintiffs/victims in Epstein-related lawsuits.

keyFacts: The New York Times filed a FOIA lawsuit against the Bureau of Prisons (BOP) for records related to Jeffrey Epstein.
The BOP had categorically refused to disclose any documents in response to the FOIA request, a position noted as potentially difficult to defend.
Internal emails discuss legal strategy, including potentially moving straight to summary judgment in the FOIA case.
The U.S. Attorney's Office established a coordinated process for handling Touhy requests from civil plaintiffs/victims in Epstein-related litigation.
The document references ongoing criminal matters involving alleged victims as victim-witnesses, indicating active prosecutorial work related to Epstein.
